1) SHAKESPEARE, William: Complete Works, Ed. W. J.Craig, Oxford University Press, London, 1943.
This edition includes a glossary by the Editor. This is a two-column 1172 pages book! It's out of print and you won't find it in any standard bookshop.

2) Criticism on Shakespeare's works by one of his greatest scholars, Harold Bloom. 

-BLOOM, Harold: The Anxiety of Influence: A Theory of Poetry, Oxford University Press, 2nd Edition, 1997. 
The first edition was publised in 1973

-BLOOM, Harold: "Shakespeare and the Value of Personality" and "Shakespeare and the Value of Love", in The Tanner Lectures on Human Values, Vol. 18, University of Utah Press, 1997.
